qas.question: What service did BSkyB chare additional subscription fees for?
When did Sky launch a TV advertising campaign target towards women?
WHat allows customers to get Sky+ functions if they do not subscribe to BSkyB's channels?
When did BSkyB discontinue the Sky+ Box?
What service did BSkyB give away for free unconditionally?
When did Sky launch a TV advertising campaign target towards men?
What isn't required by customers to get Sky+ functions if they do not subscribe to BSkyB's channels?
When did BSkyB upgrade the Sky+ Box?

context: BSkyB initially charged additional subscription fees for using a <a0_0><a0_1><a0_2><b5_0>Sky+ PVR<b5_0/><a0_2/><a0_1/><a0_0/> with their service; waiving the charge for subscribers whose package included two or more premium channels. This changed as from 1 July 2007, and now customers that have Sky+ and subscribe to any BSkyB subscription package get Sky+ included at no extra charge. Customers that do not subscribe to BSkyB's channels can still pay <a2_1>a <a2_0><b7_0>monthly fee<b7_0/><a2_1/><a2_0/> to enable Sky+ functions. <a3_1>In <a3_0><b8_0>January 2010<b8_0/><a3_1/><a3_0/> BSkyB discontinued the <b9_0>Sky+ Box<b9_0/>, limited the standard Sky Box to Multiroom upgrade only and started to issue the <a4_0><a4_1><a4_2>Sky+HD Box<a4_2/><a4_1/><a4_0/> as standard, thus giving all new subscribers the functions of Sky+. In <a3_2>February 2011<a3_2/> BSkyB discontinued the non-HD variant of its Multiroom box, offering a smaller version of the <a2_2>SkyHD box<a2_2/> without Sky+ functionality. In <a1_0><a1_1><b6_0>September 2007<b6_0/><a1_1/><a1_0/>, Sky launched a new TV advertising campaign targeting Sky+ at women. As of 31 <a1_2>March 2008<a1_2/>, Sky had 3,393,000 Sky+ users.
